required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fluciclovine (Axumin) PET/CT vs. NaF PET/CT in Prostate Cancer Osseous Metastatic Disease
clinical_study.official_title: [F-18] Fluciclovine (Axumin) PET/CT vs. [F-18] NaF PET/CT in the Evaluation of Prostate Cancer Osseous Metastatic Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to look at whether F-18 Fluciclovine (i.e. Axumin) is better or as good as F-18 Sodium Fluoride (F-18 NaF) when looking at bone disease from prostate cancer. Axumin is a radioactive agent used on a positron/computed tomography (PET/CT) camera to look for prostate cancer in general.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study will assess the diagnostic performance of [F-18] fluciclovine PET/CT compared to [F-18] NaF PET/CT as the reference standard. Each bone lesion identified on [F-18] NaF PET/CT will be compared with the level of [F-18] fluciclovine uptake
The primary objective is to assess [F-18] fluciclovine efficacy in the evaluation of osseous metastatic disease in prostate cancer on a lesion-by-lesion comparison with [F-18] NaF as a the reference standard.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of lesions seen by [F-18] NaF PET/CT which are also seen by [F-18] fluciclovine PET/CT
primary_outcome.time_frame: At time of scan, up to 60 minutes per scan
primary_outcome.description: Agreement of imaging methods as measured by number of lesions seen by [F-18] NaF PET/CT which are also seen by [F-18] fluciclovine PET/CT broken down by diagnostic score on a lesion-by-lesion basis (1 to 5) Definitely benign Probably benign Equivocal Probably malignant Definitely malignant

primary_outcome.time_frame: At time of scan, up to 60 minutes per scan
primary_outcome.description: Accuracy of [F-18] fluciclovine PET/CT compared to [F-18] NaF PET/CT evaluated via sensitivity Sensitivity is the number of true positives (TP) divided by the sum of TP and false negatives (FN): Sensitivity = TP / (TP+FN)

primary_outcome.time_frame: At time of scan, up to 60 minutes per scan
primary_outcome.description: Accuracy of [F-18] fluciclovine PET/CT compared to [F-18] NaF PET/CT evaluated via specificity Specificity is the number of true Negatives (TN) divided by the sum of TN and false positives (FP): Sensitivity = TN / (TN+FP)

primary_outcome.time_frame: At time of scan, up to 60 minutes per scan
primary_outcome.description: Accuracy of [F-18] fluciclovine PET/CT compared to [F-18] NaF PET/CT evaluated via PPV PPV is the number of true TP divided by the sum of TP and FP: Sensitivity = TP / (TP+FP)

primary_outcome.time_frame: At time of scan, up to 60 minutes per scan
primary_outcome.description: Accuracy of [F-18] fluciclovine PET/CT compared to [F-18] NaF PET/CT evaluated via NPV NPV is the number of true TN divided by the sum of TN and FN: Sensitivity = TN / (TN+FN)

primary_outcome.time_frame: At time of scan, up to 60 minutes per scan
primary_outcome.description: Accuracy of [F-18] fluciclovine PET/CT compared to [F-18] NaF PET/CT evaluated via AUC using Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) curves

arm_group.arm_group_label: NaF PET/CT scan and F-18 fluciclovine PET/CT
arm_group.description: Visit 1: Participant receives a whole body [F-18] NaF PET/CT (diagnostic study) Visit 2: Participant receives a whole body [F-18] fluciclovine PET/CT within 3 weeks of Visit 1

intervention.description: Radiotracer F-18 NaF used on the PET/CT imaging
intervention.arm_group_label: NaF PET/CT scan and F-18 fluciclovine PET/CT

intervention.description: F-18 fluciclovine (Axumin Â®) used on the PET/CT camera
intervention.arm_group_label: NaF PET/CT scan and F-18 fluciclovine PET/CT

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Referred for initial staging or restaging of prostate cancers with clinical suspicion of bone metastases.
- Must understand and voluntarily sign an Informed Consent Document
Exclusion Criteria:
-Cannot tolerate imaging up to 60 minutes of total imaging

overall_official.affiliation: University Hospitals Cleveland Medical Center, Case Comprehensive Cancer Center

facility.name: University Hospitals Cleveland Medical Center, Case Comprehensive Cancer Center

patient_data.ipd_description: No current plans to share IPD
